name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 8, China Military TV released a video of soldiers training, showing the heroic spirit of the soldiers. As a result, tens of thousands of netizens ridiculed in the comment section: "How long will it take to attack Myawaddy?" "Brother Long is doing square dance again" "Please trust the country and show your Chinese passport when you are abroad"

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
January 9 (Released), Guizhou. A man said that his father was killed by a 13-year-old minor who broke into his house. After hiding the body, the minor calmly fetched water to clean up the blood stains at the scene.
And after committing the crime, he went home and continued to go to school as if nothing had happened, and asked the police why they were looking for him with a smile as if nothing had happened.
The man said: "There are more and more juvenile murderers, and the word "juvenile" should not be a golden ticket to avoid death."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 10, a Russian woman said that many Russian product stores have opened in Beijing recently, but she has never seen many of the products in the stores. What's more exaggerated is that the Russian words on the store's door are wrong. She joked, "I am the only Russian in the whole store."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 10, it was reported that Li Shuguang, former chairman of Wuliangye Group, was investigated for suspected serious violations of discipline and laws.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
After Chinese YouTube blogger "I am Yan Lu" traveled to Taiwan last year, he often praised Taiwan in his YouTube videos. Recently, netizens discovered that he had suddenly closed his channel, and his online trace could not be found on domestic social platforms, as if he had disappeared from the world.
 It is reported that before Yan Dalu disappeared, he waved the blue sky and white sun flag in his last video, congratulated the Republic of China on its 113th birthday, and expressed his agreement with Lai Qingde’s theory of motherland during the Double Ten celebration. There is speculation that Yan Dalu’s disappearance may be related to this. .
 Yan Dalu said in the video, "The Chinese Communist regime is the counter-institution that created the Republic of China." "The Republic of China deserves to be the big brother of the People's Republic of China."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: https://t.co/lxQJiy1t6I

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Human trafficking is not far from us. Even if you don't go to Thailand, you may still be trafficked in China, and the police may not file a case.
In 23 years, the Thai police said that nearly 200 Chinese were trafficked from Thailand to Myawaddy, Myanmar every day. Myawaddy Town is the second largest human trafficking center in Southeast Asia.
At the same time, according to the help documents established by the families of trafficked people, roughly more than half of the human trafficking incidents occurred in Yunnan and Guangxi, especially Xishuangbanna.
There are quite a few cases of help seeking, where the family members called the police but the police did not file a case.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On January 10, CCTV's undercover investigation revealed that health certificates can be obtained by paying money, and even those with active infectious diseases can get the certificate. An industrial chain has been formed. Reporters even used soybean paste instead of fecal samples to pass the physical examination.
Health certificates are a health screening item that must be taken every year by confinement nannies, babysitters, catering practitioners, etc. to prevent these service personnel from transmitting tuberculosis, cholera, and viral hepatitis other than hepatitis B to consumers.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Lu Jian, a teacher at Jiangsu University School of Medicine, was threatened and harassed by the school after he used his real name to refute the false rumors of Jiangsu University a few days ago. On January 9, he returned to Zhenjiang from a business trip and posted a message again, waiting for the police to come and arrest him. Recently, the keyhole of the address on his ID card was blocked with chewing gum, and he had to spend more than 100 yuan to replace the lock core.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Many master's and doctoral students from prestigious universities enter tobacco factories as front-line operators
Recently, tobacco companies in many places have released the list of college students to be recruited in 2024. Zhejiang China Tobacco plans to recruit 123 people for production technology operation positions in Hangzhou and Ningbo, including graduates from Peking University, Fudan University, University of Hong Kong, University of Sydney and other famous domestic and foreign universities; Jinan Cigarette Factory recruited 95 fresh graduates, including 3 doctoral students.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Yihezhuang Middle School in Zhuozhou, Baoding, Hebei, asked students to sign a letter of commitment to give up the high school entrance examination without the parents' knowledge
Recently, a parent posted a video to defend his rights. Before the child took the high school entrance examination, the school asked the child to sign a letter of commitment to give up the high school entrance examination and let the child go through the independent recruitment. The parent went to the school to defend his rights, "The principal hid and refused to come out (to meet)." It is suspected that a parent pointed out in an interaction with netizens that the parent's signature column was signed by the child on behalf of the child.
Education Bureau: Every student has the right to take the high school entrance examination

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 11, the Nanchang Public Security Bureau in Jiangxi issued a notice stating that Li Yixue had been taken away from the hospital by his father. The notice stated that Li Yixue had lived alone since high school, had a withdrawn personality, and was radical and extreme in dealing with things. On December 22, 24, Li Yixue was forcibly sent to the Jiangxi Provincial Veterans Hospital for treatment by multiple departments "in accordance with the law and regulations." On January 4, he was diagnosed with obsessive-compulsive disorder, specific phobia, personality disorder, and risk assessment level 3 at the Veterans Hospital.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 11, the WPS document "Stars Go Home Plan" where more than a thousand families of Chinese victims of human trafficking sought help was no longer accessible. This document attracted everyone's attention after the Wang Xing incident, and thousands of families of Chinese victims of human trafficking registered for help. Not all victims of trafficking were trafficked in Thailand. About half of the victims were last seen at the Yunnan border in China. Some families wrote in the help registration: They have called the police but the police did not file a case.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
It is reported that the initiator of the "Star Home Plan" WPS document that the victims' families sought help from had just been interviewed and reported by the Beijing News and Modern Express. 
The news showed that among the more than 1,000 missing people, the youngest was only 15 years old, of which more than 700 were trafficked at the Yunnan border and more than 300 were trafficked in Thailand. 
Yunnan corresponds to the northern Myanmar region, and Thailand corresponds to the human trafficking in the eastern Myanmar region.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: January 3, workers at Qiaochu Shanshui Haoting in Tongdao County, Huaihua City, Hunan Province, built a wall on the road to demand their wages

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On January 10, after actor Wang Xing was kidnapped, Eason Chan decided to cancel his Bangkok concert tour, which had already sold out. The concert was originally scheduled for February 22, but was canceled due to safety issues. Fans who purchased tickets on the official website can get a full refund.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
January 7th Shanghai Pudong District Lingang Academy Community Resettlement Phase 5 China Railway Group Project Department, workers drove trucks to dump garbage to block the door to protest against unpaid wages
January 8th Shandong Liaocheng People gathered in front of Liaocheng Xinhe Livestock Cooperative to defend their rights, shouting: Give us back our hard-earned money
January 6th Zhejiang Jiaxing Haining City Xucun Town Yanshang Clothing Workers gathered at Haining City Government to demand wages
January 9th Shandong Liaocheng Huayuan Road Primary School Workers used excavators to pull banners to block the door and demanded to pay back the money

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
January 9th, Hubei Huanggang Jiahao New Harbor, owners gathered to protest against high parking fees. There were a large number of police officers at the scene. Some people were taken away by the police. The rest of the people at the scene surrounded the police and shouted.
Last 3 videos: January 9th, Hunan Changsha New Town International Huadu, owners clashed with the property company over parking space issues. A large number of owners gathered to defend their rights. The owners pushed down the parking poles in the community

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
As the year draws to a close, many places across the country have seen people jumping off buildings to demand their wages.
January 7th, Yibin, Sichuan, Ideal City, workers sat outside the window in the cold wind to demand their wages.
January 8th, somewhere in Gansu, at least five workers gathered on the roof and threatened to jump off the building to demand their wages.
January 9th, Zhengzhou, Henan, workers stood on the awning at the entrance of the Henan Provincial Highway Engineering Bureau Group office building and threatened to jump off the building to demand their wages.
January 10th, Xi'an, Shaanxi, Majiawan Four Seasons Huachen Hotel, workers stood on the edge of the roof and threatened to jump off the building to demand their wages.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
As the year draws to a close, many places across the country have seen people jumping off buildings to demand their wages
January 9, Nanchang, Jiangxi: migrant workers sitting on the edge of a rooftop threatened to jump off the building to demand their wages [the video said three or four workers were on the top floor]
January 9, somewhere in Guangdong: a group of workers sitting on the edge of a newly completed building threatened to jump off the building to demand their wages
January 9, Zhengzhou, Henan: a community worker threatened to jump off the building to demand his wages

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Another Henan rural financial institution went bankrupt and ran away
January 9th, China Resources Taifu Cooperative in Anyang, Henan, ran away, and customers with deposits gathered at the government gate to defend their rights

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
The owners collectively chanted slogans and demonstrated because they were unable to obtain real estate certificates for their houses.
January 10th, Wuhan, Hubei Province The owner of Jinhui Jiang Yueyunzhu went to the Letters and Calls Bureau to defend his rights because the house he purchased was mortgaged by the developer and he was unable to obtain a full invoice and proof of ownership. As a result, he was unable to apply for a real estate certificate.
Some owners made mocking banners in the hope that petitions would be implemented in a practical way. The owners collectively carried banners and marched on the road shouting slogans

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
The University of Michigan in the United States has terminated its cooperation with Shanghai Jiao Tong University on the grounds of national security.
The University of Michigan announced on its official website on January 10 that its president, Ono Mitsuo, made this decision on Friday, ending the 20-year academic cooperation between the two schools.
U.S. House of Representatives member Mullner said that the joint college of the University of Michigan and Jiaotong University is helping China achieve military modernization. Last October, five Chinese students who went to the University of Michigan through an exchange program were eventually found to be engaged in intelligence activities at Camp Grayling.
The University of Michigan is the third American university in the past five months to terminate cooperation with Chinese universities due to national security risks raised by the ad hoc committee. Last fall, Georgia Institute of Technology announced the termination of cooperation with Georgia Institute of Technology Shenzhen Institute, and the University of California, Berkeley also terminated cooperation with Tsinghua University.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: January 10, Chongqing. Travel blogger Xiaogang encountered an 80-year-old man falling down while cycling, with a large bloodstain on the ground. Xiaogang immediately called 110 and 120, but the phone could not be dialed for a long time, and the prompt "The police station is busy, please wait" aroused doubts from netizens. Some netizens said: "If you are being chased by bad guys and can't get through to 110, how desperate it would be." At present, the official account of Chongqing Public Security has enabled "The author has selected some comments not to be displayed"
